alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Kosciusko; Marshall; Pulaski; Starke (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 9:24PM EST until March 10 at 1:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Indiana... Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Fulton OH, Williams and Defiance Counties. Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Starke, Kosciusko, Pulaski, Fulton IN and Marshall Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio near Newville affecting De Kalb, Allen IN and Defiance Counties. North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville affecting Noble County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Indiana... Tippecanoe River above Winamac affecting Carroll, Pulaski and White Counties. .Recent rainfall and snowmelt has led to rises on area rivers over the past few days. Rain and snow on Friday may lead to additional rises on area rivers and streams this upcoming weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tippecanoe River near Ora. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The river is at flood stage...significant lowland and rural flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Wednesday /7:45 PM CST Wednesday/ the stage was 12.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Wednesday /7:45 PM CST Wednesday/ was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 10.7 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
